original: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
analyzed: dhammesu dhamma anupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhā domanassa
translated: I’ve meditated observing the body as a body — ardent, alert, and mindful, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world.

original: Imesaṁ khvāhaṁ, āvuso, catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā mahābhiññataṁ patto.
analyzed: imesam khvāha āvuso catunnam sati paṭṭhānānam bhāvita ttā bahulīkata ttā mahā abhiñña tam patto
translated: It’s because I’ve developed and pursued these four establishments of mindfulness that I’ve attained great direct knowledge.

original: Imesañca panāhaṁ, āvuso, catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā sahassaṁ lokaṁ abhijānāmī”ti.🔽Aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: imesam ca pana āha āvuso catunnam satipaṭṭhānānam bhāvita ttā bahulīkata ttā sahassam lokam abhijānāmi iti  aṭṭhama
translated: And it’s because I’ve developed and pursued these four establishments of mindfulness that I claim to have comprehended the thousand worlds with my mind.”

original: Saṁyutta Nikāya 47.29
analyzed: sayutta nikāya
translated: The eighth section on the four establishments of mindfulness is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with the Householder Upāli, the first, is finished.🔽The Collection on the Four Establishments of Mindfulness, the first, is finished.🔽The Collection on the Four Establishments of Mindfulness, the second

analyzed: sirivaḍḍhasutta
translated: With Sirivaḍḍha

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā ānando rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmai ānandaḥ rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: One time, the venerable Ānanda was staying near Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sirivaḍḍho gahapati ābādhiko hoti dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sirivaḍḍhaḥ gahapati ābādhikaḥ hoti dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: Now at that time the householder Sirivaḍḍha was afflicted, suffering, and gravely ill.

original: Atha kho sirivaḍḍho gahapati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho sirivaḍḍhaḥ gahapati aññataram purisam āmantesi
translated: Then the householder Sirivaḍḍha addressed a man, saying:

original: “ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmato ānandassa pāde sirasā vanda:
analyzed: ehi tva ambho purisa yena āyasmataḥ ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmataḥ ānandassa pāde sirasā vanda
translated: “Come, good man, approach the venerable Ānanda, pay respect in my name with your head at his feet, and say:

original: ‘sirivaḍḍho, bhante, gahapati ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
analyzed: sirivaḍḍhaḥ bhante gahapati ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: ‘Venerable sir, the householder Sirivaḍḍha is sick, afflicted, gravely ill.

original: So āyasmato ānandassa pāde sirasā vandatī’ti.
analyzed: saḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: He bows down at the feet of Venerable Ānanda.’

original: Evañca vadehi:
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: And say this:

original: ‘sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando yena sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kira bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ yena sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: ‘It would be good, venerable sir, if Venerable Ānanda would visit the householder Sirivaḍḍha’s home out of compassion.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yenāyasmā ānando
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho so purisaḥ sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa paṭissutvā yena ayasmai ānando
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” he replied, and he went to Venerable Ānanda,

original: tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamanta
translated: bowed, sat down,

original: nisinno kho so puriso āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:🔽“sirivaḍḍho, bhante, gahapati ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno, so āyasmato ānandassa pāde sirasā vandati.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ kho saḥ purisaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca  sirivaḍḍhaḥ bhante gahapati ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ saḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa pāde sirasā vandati
translated: and told him what Sirivaḍḍha had said.

original: Evañca vadeti:
analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: He then added,

original: ‘sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando yena sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kira bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ yena sirivaḍḍhassa gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: ‘It would be good, venerable sir, if Venerable Ānanda would visit the householder Sirivaḍḍha’s home out of compassion.’”

original: Adhivāsesi kho āyasmā ānando tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sirivaḍḍhassa
analyzed: adhivāsesi kho āyasmai ānandaḥ tuṇhībhāvena  atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena sirivaḍḍhassa
translated: The venerable Ānanda accepted in silence.

original: gahapatissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja
analyzed: gahapatissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi nisajja
translated: Then, when it was morning, he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the house of the householder Sirivaḍḍha, where he sat down on the seat made ready.

original: kho āyasmā ānando sirivaḍḍhaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: kho āyasmai ānandaḥ sirivaḍḍham gahapatim etat avoca
translated: After sitting down, he said to the householder Sirivaḍḍha:

original: “kacci te, gahapati, khamanīyaṁ kacci yāpanīyaṁ, kacci dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti, no abhikkamanti; paṭikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no abhikkamo”ti?
analyzed: kacci te gahapati khamanīyam kacci yāpanīya kacci dukkhā vedanā paṭikkamanti no abhikkamanti paṭikkama usānam paññāyati no abhikkama uti
translated: “I hope you’re bearing up, householder, I hope you’re getting better. I hope your painful feelings are subsiding and not increasing, and that their subsiding, not their increase, is to be discerned.”

original: “Na me, bhante, khamanīyaṁ na yāpanīyaṁ. Bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti, no paṭikkamanti; abhikkamosānaṁ paññāyati, no paṭikkamo”ti.
analyzed: na me bhante khamanīyam na yāpanīya bāḷhā me dukkhāḥ vedanāḥ abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti abhikkama usānam paññāyati no paṭikkama uti
translated: “I’m not bearing up, venerable Ānanda, I’m not getting better. My painful feelings are increasing, not subsiding, and their increase, not their subsiding, is to be discerned.”

original: “Tasmātiha te, gahapati, evaṁ sikkhitabbaṁ:
analyzed: tasmā ati ha te gahapati evam sikkhitabba
translated: “In that case, householder, you should train in this way:

translated: ‘I will dwell contemplating the body in the body, ardent, clearly comprehending, mindful, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world.

original: citte …pe…
analyzed: citte pe
